paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR variant p.Ser43Asn, including penetrance data and individual case details.

patients.phenotype: familial amyloidosis with isolated cardiac phenotype

individual_records.phenotype_details: asymptomatic, marked left ventricular hypertrophy, normal ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: At presentation, she was completely asymptomatic, reported regular sport activity, and declined symptoms pertaining to ATTR amyloidosis.

individual_records.phenotype_details: denied having any symptoms, echocardiography showed LVH
individual_records.evidence_sentence: He denied having any symptoms and his past medical history was unremarkable.

individual_records.phenotype_details: diagnosed with cardiac ATTR amyloidosis, died due to refractory heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Patient C had received an ICD for primary prevention of sudden cardiac death but died due to refractory heart failure 2 years after diagnosis at the age of 55.

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with an aggressive clinical course leading to advanced heart failure.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with disease in the family.
variants.population_frequency: Observed in one out of 1286 participants of the THAOS registry.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multiple case reports and family history.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is very rare and has been associated with an isolated cardiac phenotype.
key_quotes: In the vast majority of patients, an isolated cardiac phenotype was observed with patients having already typical findings of cardiac amyloid infiltration (LVH, diastolic dysfunction) at their early 40’s.
Both our patients have no offspring while other maternal relatives have lived or live in Italy.

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
